intro: Isodon mucronatus, commonly known as the narrow-leaved germander, is a perennial herb native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its small, tubular flowers are usually purple or blue, arranged in whorls along the stem. Isodon mucronatus is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to dry, Mediterranean-type climates.
